text: Marion Gibbons (née Chesney; 10 June 1936https://www.google.com/search?client=ms-android- samsung&biw;=412&bih;=652&tbm;=bks&sxsrf;=ACYBGNSUvgUmO9W-J_VCr-1OYaV9aWqPYQ%3A1577824499380&ei;=87ALXpPwFobbsAfjmaMI&q;=Marion+Chesney+Born+in+Glasgow%2C+Scotland%2C+10+June+1936&oq;=Marion+Chesney+Born+in+Glasgow%2C+Scotland%2C+10+June+1936&gs;_l=mobile- gws- serp.12...12597.12597.0.13358.1.1.0.0.0.0.501.501.5-1.1.0....0...1c.2.64.mobile- gws-serp..0.0.0....0.FtUczK0Xwlk - 30 December 2019) was a Scottish writer. She wrote romance and mystery novels from 1979 until her death. She her books under a form of her maiden name, Marion Chesney, including the Travelling Matchmaker and Daughters of Mannerling series. Her best known works were Death of a Gossip, Death of an Outsider and Agatha Raisin and the Deadly Dance. Chesney was born in Glasgow. She died on 30 December 2019 at the age of 83.MC Beaton, prolific author who created the phlegmatic PC Hamish Macbeth and the amateur sleuth Agatha Raisin – obituary ==References== Category:1936 births Category:2019 deaths Category:Scottish novelists Category:Writers from Glasgow
title: Marion Chesney
